meanings.sent1: The ancient prophecy seemed to foreordain his victory in the battle.
meanings.sent2: The weather forecast can foreordain whether we should bring an umbrella.
meanings.sent3: The fortune teller jokingly foreordained that he would find a penny on the ground.
meanings.sent4: Her meticulous planning foreordained the success of the event.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's strict rules foreordain a disciplined classroom environment.

meanings.sent1: The company policy will foreordain the outcome of the upcoming meeting.
meanings.sent2: She tried to foreordain the best route to avoid traffic.
meanings.sent3: The magic eight ball playfully foreordained that he would have a lucky day.
meanings.sent4: His actions today will foreordain his future success.
meanings.sent5: The architect's blueprint will foreordain the design of the new building.
